summary: The Strengthening Local Food Security Act of 2025 establishes a program to support local food systems. The Secretary of Agriculture will enter into agreements with eligible government units to purchase food from local and regional producers, including seafood, produce, meat, and dairy, and distribute it to hunger relief organizations and schools. The bill aims to improve food security, support local producers, and strengthen food systems. Funding is provided via the Commodity Credit Corporation and authorized appropriations for fiscal years 2025-2029.
